00037         /**
00038          * Represents the life time of a single request/response pair of a Ruby on Rails
00039          * application.
00040          *
00041          * Session is used to forward a single HTTP request to a Ruby on Rails application.
00042          * A Session has two communication channels: one for reading data from
00043          * the RoR application, and one for writing data to the RoR application.
00044          *
00045          * In general, a session object is to be used in the following manner:
00046          *
00047          *  -# Convert the HTTP request headers into a string, as expected by sendHeaders().
00048          *     Then send that string by calling sendHeaders().
00049          *  -# In case of a POST of PUT request, send the HTTP request body by calling
00050          *     sendBodyBlock(), possibly multiple times.
00051          *  -# Close the writer channel since you're now done sending data.
00052          *  -# The HTTP response can now be read through the reader channel (getReader()).
00053          *  -# When the HTTP response has been read, the session must be closed.
00054          *     This is done by destroying the Session object.
00055          *
00056          * A usage example is shown in Application::connect(). 
00057          */
00058         class Session {
00059         public:
00060                 virtual ~Session() {}
00061                 
00062                 /**
00063                  * Send HTTP request headers to the RoR application. The HTTP headers must be
00064                  * converted into CGI headers, and then encoded into a string that matches this grammar:
00065                  *
00066                    @verbatim
00067                    headers ::= header*
00068                    header ::= name NUL value NUL
00069                    name ::= notnull+
00070                    value ::= notnull+
00071                    notnull ::= "\x01" | "\x02" | "\x02" | ... | "\xFF"
00072                    NUL = "\x00"
00073                    @endverbatim
00074                  *
00075                  * This method should be the first one to be called during the lifetime of a Session
00076                  * object. Otherwise strange things may happen.
00077                  *
00078                  * @param headers The HTTP request headers, converted into CGI headers and encoded as
00079                  *                a string, according to the description.
00080                  * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>headers</tt>.
00081                  * @pre headers != NULL
00082                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00083                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00084                  */
00085                 virtual void sendHeaders(const char *headers, unsigned int size) {
00086                         int writer = getWriter();
00087                         if (writer == -1) {
00088                                 throw IOException("Cannot write headers to the request handler because the writer channel has already been closed.");
00089                         }
00090                         try {
00091                                 MessageChannel(writer).writeScalar(headers, size);
00092                         } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00093                                 throw SystemException("An error occured while writing headers to the request handler", e.code());
00094                         }
00095                 }
00096                 
00097                 /**
00098                  * Convenience shortcut for sendHeaders(const char *, unsigned int)
00099                  * @param headers
00100                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00101                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00102                  */
00103                 virtual void sendHeaders(const string &headers) {
00104                         sendHeaders(headers.c_str(), headers.size());
00105                 }
00106                 
00107                 /**
00108                  * Send a chunk of HTTP request body data to the RoR application.
00109                  * You can call this method as many times as is required to transfer
00110                  * the entire HTTP request body.
00111                  *
00112                  * This method should only be called after a sendHeaders(). Otherwise
00113                  * strange things may happen.
00114                  *
00115                  * @param block A block of HTTP request body data to send.
00116                  * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>block</tt>.
00117                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00118                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00119                  */
00120                 virtual void sendBodyBlock(const char *block, unsigned int size) {
00121                         int writer = getWriter();
00122                         if (writer == -1) {
00123                                 throw IOException("Cannot write request body block to the request handler because the writer channel has already been closed.");
00124                         }
00125                         try {
00126                                 MessageChannel(writer).writeRaw(block, size);
00127                         } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00128                                 throw SystemException("An error occured while request body to the request handler", e.code());
00129                         }
00130                 }
00131                 
00132                 /**
00133                  * Get the reader channel's file descriptor.
00134                  *
00135                  * @pre The reader channel has not been closed.
00136                  */
00137                 virtual int getReader() = 0;
00138                 
00139                 /**
00140                  * Close the reader channel. This method may be safely called multiple times.
00141                  */
00142                 virtual void closeReader() = 0;
00143                 
00144                 /**
00145                  * Get the writer channel's file descriptor. You should rarely have to
00146                  * use this directly. One should only use sendHeaders() and sendBodyBlock()
00147                  * whenever possible.
00148                  *
00149                  * @pre The writer channel has not been closed.
00150                  */
00151                 virtual int getWriter() = 0;
00152                 
00153                 /**
00154                  * Close the writer channel. This method may be safely called multiple times.
00155                  */
00156                 virtual void closeWriter() = 0;
00157         };

00160         /**
00161          * A structure containing data that both StandardSession and Application
00162          * may access. Since Application and StandardSession may have different
00163          * life times (i.e. one can be destroyed before the other), they both
00164          * have a smart pointer referencing a SharedData structure. Only
00165          * when both the StandardSession and the Application object have been
00166          * destroyed, will the SharedData object be destroyed as well.
00167          */
00168         struct SharedData {
00169                 unsigned int sessions;
00170         };
00171         
00172         typedef shared_ptr<SharedData> SharedDataPtr;
00173 
00174         /**
00175          * A "standard" implementation of Session.
00176          */
00177         class StandardSession: public Session {
00178         protected:
00179                 SharedDataPtr data;
00180                 CloseCallback closeCallback;
00181                 int reader;
00182                 int writer;
00183                 
00184         public:
00185                 StandardSession(SharedDataPtr data, const CloseCallback &closeCallback, int reader, int writer) {
00186                         this->data = data;
00187                         this->closeCallback = closeCallback;
00188                         data->sessions++;
00189                         this->reader = reader;
00190                         this->writer = writer;
00191                 }
00192         
00193                 virtual ~StandardSession() {
00194                         data->sessions--;
00195                         closeReader();
00196                         closeWriter();
00197                         closeCallback(*this);
00198                 }
00199                 
00200                 virtual int getReader() {
00201                         return reader;
00202                 }
00203                 
00204                 virtual void closeReader() {
00205                         if (reader != -1) {
00206                                 close(reader);
00207                                 reader = -1;
00208                         }
00209                 }
00210                 
00211                 virtual int getWriter() {
00212                         return writer;
00213                 }
00214                 
00215                 virtual void closeWriter() {
00216                         if (writer != -1) {
00217                                 close(writer);
00218                                 writer = -1;
00219                         }
00220                 }
00221         };

00270         /**
00271          * Connect to this application instance with the purpose of sending
00272          * a request to the application. Once connected, a new session will
00273          * be opened. This session represents the life time of a single
00274          * request/response pair, and can be used to send the request
00275          * data to the application instance, as well as receiving the response
00276          * data.
00277          *
00278          * The use of connect() is demonstrated in the following example.
00279          * @code
00280          *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00281          *   Application::SessionPtr session(app->connect("/home/webapps/foo"));
00282          *   
00283          *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00284          *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00285          *   session->sendBodyBlock(...);
00286          *   // Done sending data, so we close the writer channel.
00287          *   session->closeWriter();
00288          *
00289          *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00290          *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00291          *   // Done reading data, so we close the reader channel.
00292          *   session->closeReader();
00293          *
00294          *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00295          *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00296          *   session.reset();
00297          *
00298          *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00299          *   // the previous session is closed.
00300          *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00301          * @endcode
00302          *
00303          * Note that a RoR application instance can only process one
00304          * request at the same time, and thus only one session at the same time.
00305          * You <b>must</b> close a session when you no longer need if. You you
00306          * call connect() without having properly closed a previous session,
00307          * you might cause a deadlock because the application instance may be
00308          * waiting for you to close the previous session.
00309          *
00310          * @return A smart pointer to a Session object, which represents the created session.
00311          * @param closeCallback A function which will be called when the session has been closed.
00312          * @post this->getSessions() == old->getSessions() + 1
00313          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00314          * @throws IOException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00315          */
00316         SessionPtr connect(const CloseCallback &closeCallback) const {
00317                 int ret;
00318                 do {
00319                         ret = write(listenSocket, "", 1);
00320                 } while ((ret == -1 && errno == EINTR) || ret == 0);
00321                 if (ret == -1) {
00322                         throw SystemException("Cannot request a new session from the request handler", errno);
00323                 }
00324                 
00325                 try {
00326                         MessageChannel channel(listenSocket);
00327                         int reader = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00328                         int writer = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00329                         return ptr(new StandardSession(data, closeCallback, reader, writer));
00330                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00331                         throw SystemException("Cannot receive one of the session file descriptors from the request handler", e.code());
00332                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00333                         string message("Cannot receive one of the session file descriptors from the request handler");
00334                         message.append(e.what());
00335                         throw IOException(message);
00336                 }
00337         }
00338
